result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrail D Redd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrail D Redd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Tyrail D Redd.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Court addressed Notice of Alibi. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Status hearing and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Jury Status hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defendant's Notice of Alibi; received and filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine and Request for Trial Procedures; received and filed.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, expires December 12, 2022.

Defendant Tyrail D Redd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Tyrail D Redd.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in court for State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Tyrail D Redd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Tyrail D Redd.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #18CF272. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Bohn. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

received and filed.
Attorney Theodore OReilly.

Defendant Tyrail D Redd not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Spd has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Tyrail D. Redd - #2022008171, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Correspondence from Defendant dated July 16, 2022.  (Tyrail D Redd - #2022008171, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Tyrail D Redd not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $55,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified legal appointments.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMG DOB: 1/13/2004; LMH DOB: 7/12/2005; JKM DOB: 6/19/2003; RRJ DOB: 8/11/2004

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Tyrail D Redd in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Tyrail D Redd in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrail D Redd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
